chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: In this lecture we will discuss continuous and discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We can broadly classify signals into two types.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: The first one is continuous time signals and the second one is discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We will start our discussion with continuous time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: The signals which are specified for every value of time t are called as continuous time

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: signals and they are represented by x inside the parenthesis t where x is the dependent

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: variable and t is the independent variable and you can see signal xt is single variable

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: signal because we only have one variable which is time t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now I will take one very basic continuous time signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Y axis is always for function or signal and here function or signal is xt.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: X axis is always for independent variable and independent variable is time t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So x axis is for time t and this is minus t and we have one signal which is having amplitude

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: equal to a when time is equal to t0 then this signal starts to decline like this and it

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: becomes 0 at this point.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: It starts to decline on the other side of the y axis also and it becomes 0 at this point

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: and after this it remains 0 till infinity and it remains 0 till minus infinity.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So this is our continuous time signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We are calling it continuous time signal because you can see this signal is defined or specified

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: for every value of time t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can find out the signal xt for every value of time t from minus infinity to plus infinity.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now we will discuss discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: The signals which are specified at discrete time intervals or you can say discrete values

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: of time are called as discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: In short we write discrete time signal as DTS and in short we write continuous time

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: signals as CTS.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: The representation of discrete time signal is small x inside the square bracket small

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now small n is not time but it is integer.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So this is the difference between representation of continuous time signal and discrete time

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We have the square bracket in place of parenthesis and we have integer in place of time t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So dependent variable is x and independent variable is small n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now we will plot the discrete time signal using the plot of continuous time signal and

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: as the definition of discrete time signal says it is specified at discrete time intervals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: It is not specified for every value of time t but it is specified at discrete time intervals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Let's say the signal xt is specified at t0 it is equal to a and it is also specified

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: at t1 and this is the value of the signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: It is specified at t2 it is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: In the same way it is specified here at t3 all the way to tn.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Here it is specified at t-1 this is the value.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: It is specified at t-2, t-3 all the way to t-n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So you can see the signal is not specified at every value of time t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: If you want to find out signal xt between time t1 and time t0 you cannot find it because

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: it is not defined.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So we have plot of discrete time signal in which the signal is defined only at discrete

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: intervals of time.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We discretize the time axis, y-axis is for xn.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: At t0 the signal is a, at t1 this is the value of signal, at t2 signal is 0, at t3 again

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: it is 0, at t-1 this is the value of the signal, at t-2 signal is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: This is minus t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So this is the plot of discrete time signal and time interval, the time interval delta

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: t which is equal to t1-t0, t2-t1, t3-t2 and so on may or may not be same.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: If this time interval is same this means t1-t0 is equal to t2-t1 is equal to t3-t2 equal

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: to tn-tn-1.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: If this is true then we say the discrete time signal is uniformly sampled.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: When time interval is same the signal is uniformly sampled and when time interval is not same

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: the signal is non-uniformly sampled.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now we will discuss one very important thing, the existence of this integer.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can see the x-axis is for time but how we got the integer as the independent variable.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Let's consider the case of uniformly sampled signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Because of this delta t will remain same and let's say delta t, the time interval is equal

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: to capital T and when this happens t1-t0 is equal to capital T.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: In the same way t2-t1 is equal to capital T, tn-tn-1 is also equal to capital T and

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: let's say t0 is equal to 0 and when this happens we need to make t1 equal to t so that t-0

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: is equal to t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Similarly t2 will be 2t, t3 will be 3t and tn will be nt and when we are having t as

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: the independent variable we cannot write xn, we will have x inside the square parenthesis

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: and t and we cancel out t so we have 0, here we will have 1, we will have 2, we will have

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: 3 all the way to n so this axis is now for integer n and from this representation also

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: we will remove t.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So y-axis is for xn and x-axis is for n and we have the integer values like 0, 1, 2, 3

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: and so on.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: I hope you now understand why we have integer in case of discrete time signal as the independent

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: variable.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So this is all for discrete time signals and continuous time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Let's solve one example based on discrete time signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: In this example plot of discrete time signal is given and using this example I will explain

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: one more way to represent the discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: First thing we have to do is to write this small x inside the curly braces, we will write

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: small n equal to curly braces open, curly braces closed and the values which will come

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: inside these two curly braces will be the amplitude.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We have amplitude equal to 1, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1 and we will start from the left most amplitude

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: and end at right most amplitude.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So we have 1, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: These are the amplitudes but this information is incomplete because we don't have any information

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: about the independent variable n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: All these are the values of signal xn and there is no information about the integer

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: If I ask you to plot the discrete time signal using this information you cannot plot it

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: correctly.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: You know the amplitudes 1, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1 are the amplitudes of the signal but you don't

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: know at what n 1 is the amplitude of the signal, at what n 0 is the amplitude of the signal

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: and if you take it randomly, for example you take 1 as the amplitude of the signal at minus

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: 3 but 1 is the amplitude of the signal at minus 2 and once you take it at minus 3 automatically

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: you will take all the other amplitudes at wrong value of small n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: 0 will become amplitude at minus 2, 1 will become amplitude at minus 1, 2 will become

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: amplitude at 0, this 2 at 1 and this 1 at 2.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So you can see the whole plot is now shifted to the left by one place and to plot it correctly

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: we need to add information about the integer n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So let's see how we add the information about the integer n.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: We simply put one arrow right below the amplitude of xn when n is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: When n is equal to 0, amplitude of xn is equal to 1 so we will put one arrow right below

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: this 1 and this arrow indicates value of xn when n is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now using this information we can easily plot the correct signal.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: When 1 is having the arrow below it, this means this is the value of xn at n equal to

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: 0 and this automatically makes 2 as the value of xn when n is equal to 1, this 2 when n

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: is equal to 2 and this 1 when n is equal to 3 and this 0 is the value of xn when n

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: is equal to minus 1 and this 1 is the value of xn when n is equal to minus 2.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: So this is the correct information and I hope this example is clear to you.

chunks.Title: Continuous and Discrete Time Signals
chunks.Text: If you have any doubt you may ask in the comment section.
